Hi,

I have some code that, due to certain restrictions, must be compiled 
with Java1.1. I had originally developed my code and JUnit tests with 
Java1.3... and of course everything worked fine. 

Now that I have had to regress back to Java1.1 my code compiles 
(after some modification) but when executing my test suite I get a 
java.lang.VerifyError(From API 1.1 Specs : Thrown when the "verifier" 
detects that a class file, though well formed, contains some sort of 
internal inconsistency or security problem. ) 

I'm thinking this is because junit uses reflection that Java1.1 does 
not support.  Or maybe not.... 

Any ideas?

Thanks,
Noah
